content: ooddiinn tthhee mmiinnii ooccttooppuuss by johannamigurumi abbreviations difficulty magic_ring = magic_ring beginner single_crochet = single_crochet increase = increase skills required decrease = decrease invisible slip_stitch = slip_stitch crocheting in a spiral magic_ring single st = stitch crochet bobble stitch increasing decreasing chain = chain and chaining bob = bobble stitch blo = back loop only fo = fasten_off supplies + chunky chenille yarn i used toucan by hobbii yarns in pink + 12mm safety eyes + 4 5mm crochet hook + scissors + darning needle + stitch marker * polyester fiberfill for stuffing how to make a bobble stitch yarn over insert hook into stitch yarn over draw loop back through stitch yarn over pull through 2 loops repeat 4 more times until you have 6 loops on your hook yarn over and draw through all 6 loops to complete the bobble © 2024 johannamigurumi all rights reserved page 2 body 1 single_crochet 8 in a magic_ring 8 2 increase in each st around 16 3 single_crochet increase x 8 24 4 single_crochet in each st around 24 5 2 single_crochet increase x 8 32 6-10 single_crochet in each st around - 5 rounds 32 11 decrease x 16 16 attach eyes between rounds 8-9 with approximately 4 stitches showing between begin stuffing the head and continue to stuff until closed 12 blo 2 single_crochet decrease x 4 12 13 decrease x 6 6 fo and close hole © 2024 johannamigurumi all rights reserved page 3 tentacles 1 pull up a stitch from the front loop of round 12 photo 1 chain 1 *bob in same st photo 2 slip_stitch in next 2 sts photo3 *repeat until you have 8 bobs fo and weave in the ends photo 4 1 2 3 4 tip if your tentacles seem to be too small go up one size in your crochet hook © 2024 johannamigurumi all rights reserved page 4 congratulations your odin the mini octopus is complete i hope that you enjoyed making it please share your creations and tag me on instagram @johannamigurumi i would love to see them to make odin really tiny use 10mm eyes medium weight chenille or velvet yarn and a 3 25mm crochet hook i used bernat baby velvet in bleached aqua copyright 2024 © johannamigurumi all rights reserved you are not allowed to sell this pattern you are not allowed to distribute translate or publish this pattern in any form you are not allowed to alter this pattern in any form you may sell finished products made with this pattern that are handmade by yourself but please provide credit in your listings to me as the designer @johannamigurumi if you have any questions please reach out contact info instagram -
